alert.note: Alert for Clay; Lincoln; Turner; Union; Yankton (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 1:21PM MST until January 15 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, with wind gusting as high as 35 mph, patchy blowing snow is leading to scattered visibility drops below one half mile. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Turner, Lincoln, Yankton, Clay and Union Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
